name: BfROpenLab
body:
### What is BfROpenLab?
BfROpenLab is a collection of several extensions for the data analytics software KNIME (http://www.knime.org/). It is developed at the Federal Institute for Risk Assessment in Germany (BfR) and contains the following extensions:

* FoodChain-Lab
* KNIME Nodes for GIS and Graph Visualization
* KNIME Nodes for Nonlinear Regression
* KNIME Nodes for Reading Predictive Microbial Models from SBML

### How to install it?
Download KNIME from http://www.knime.org/ and install it. Extensions to KNIME can be installed via _Help -> Install New Software_ in the Main Window.

![](https://github.com/SiLeBAT/BfROpenLabResources/raw/master/GitHubPages/images/1.png)

Press _Add_ to add BfROpenLab repository: http://dl.bintray.com/silebat/generic/

![](https://github.com/SiLeBAT/BfROpenLabResources/raw/master/GitHubPages/images/2.png)

Select the extensions you would like to install, press _Next_ and follow the menu prompts.

![](https://github.com/SiLeBAT/BfROpenLabResources/raw/master/GitHubPages/images/3.png)

### FoodChain-Lab
FoodChain-Lab is an KNIME extension providing trace back and forward analysis of suspicious food items along food supply chains in case of a foodborne disease outbreak. Currently the supply chain data can be imported from an Excel template. Be aware that this template is still a prototype. In the future a different import procedure may be used. A tutorial on how to use FoodChain-Lab will be posted here soon.

[Excel template with fictional data](https://github.com/SiLeBAT/BfROpenLabResources/raw/master/GitHubPages/documents/fake_data.xls)

[Example workflow based on fictional data](https://github.com/SiLeBAT/BfROpenLabResources/raw/master/GitHubPages/workflows/Example_Workflow.zip)

[Recent Presentation of FoodChain-Lab](https://github.com/SiLeBAT/BfROpenLabResources/raw/master/GitHubPages/documents/08_FoodChainLab_Weiser.pdf)

### KNIME Nodes for GIS and Graph Visualization
[Example Workflow](https://github.com/SiLeBAT/BfROpenLab/raw/master/GitHubPages/workflows/GIS_Example.zip)

### Authors and Contributors

* Armin A. Weiser (BfR)
* Matthias Filter (BfR)
* Alexander Falenski (BfR)
* Annemarie Kaesbohrer (BfR)
* Bernd Appel (BfR)

### Support or Contact
Christian Thoens, christian.thoens@bfr.bund.de
